philosophy.mood: Cinematic tension of a spacecraft command center
philosophy.color_philosophy: Deep space blacks with electric accent punctuation
philosophy.motion_philosophy: Purposeful micro-animations that reinforce the live system feeling

design_principles: Data Density with Clarity - Pack information tightly but with clear visual hierarchy
Ambient Feedback - The UI should feel alive with subtle pulsing, glows, and state indicators
Dramatic Negative Space - Let key elements breathe while keeping secondary info compact
Brutalist Structure - Visible grid lines, exposed borders, no rounded-corner softness

masthead.name: The Masthead
features: Full-width dark bar with subtle gradient (top-to-bottom fade)
Title in large monospace with letter-spacing
Subtitle: COMMAND CENTER v2.0
Subtle animated underline using CSS gradient
System status indicator (pulsing dot showing ONLINE state)
Timestamp showing last scan time
Logo glyph symbol

control_panel.name: Mission Control Bar
features: Horizontal bar with command input styling
Input field: dark inset with cyan border on focus
Scan button: gradient from cyan to blue, uppercase text
Project stats summary (file count, connection count)
Progress indicator during scan operation

states.active: Full brightness, cyan underline, elevated surface

explorer_table.name: File Matrix
features: Dark table with alternating row backgrounds
Column headers with uppercase labels and border-bottom
Status badges as pill-shaped elements with glow effects
File paths in monospace with syntax-highlighting-style coloring
Hover state shows full row highlight
Selected row has cyan left border accent

connections_graph.name: Neural Map
features: Enhanced PyVis configuration
Node styling based on file type
Edge styling with gradient colors
Legend panel showing node/edge meanings
Zoom controls with custom styling
Connection stats panel

prd_generator.name: Document Forge
features: Split-pane layout: file info panel (left), generated PRD (right)
Export button to save PRD as file
Template selector for different PRD formats

emperor_terminal.name: Command Throne
features: Terminal-inspired interface
Mission input as command line with prompt character
Deploy button with dramatic hover/active states
Log display as scrollable terminal output
Color-coded log entries by type

loading_states: Skeleton loaders for table rows during scan
Pulsing placeholder for graph during generation
Progress bar or spinner for long operations

implementation_phases.name: Header & Control Panel Redesign
implementation_phases.goal: Transform top section into Mission Control aesthetic

implementation_phases.name: Explorer Table Overhaul
implementation_phases.goal: Make file table a visual centerpiece

implementation_phases.name: Connection Graph Enhancement
implementation_phases.goal: Transform graph into neural map visualization

implementation_phases.name: Polish & Animation
implementation_phases.goal: Add finishing touches that make it memorable

acceptance_criteria: Visual Impact: Dashboard immediately feels like a premium developer tool
Consistency: All components follow the established design system
Responsiveness: UI remains functional at different viewport sizes
Performance: Animations are smooth (60fps), no jank
Accessibility: Sufficient color contrast, keyboard navigable
Delight: At least 3 wow moments in the user experience
summary: The stereOS UI Design PRD defines a comprehensive Mission Control Noir design system with exact specifications for colors (19 CSS variables), typography (4 font families, 7 type scale levels), status badges (4 states with animations), components (7 major sections), animations (micro-interactions, page load sequence, loading states), and 8 implementation phases.
